title: BTL EMSELLA® Chair
description: Sit fully clothed while HIFEM energy contracts the entire pelvic floor, rebuilding bladder control, posture, and intimate sensation.
longDescription: BTL EMSELLA® is a medical-grade chair that emits high-intensity focused electromagnetic (HIFEM) energy. Each 28-minute session induces over 11,000 supramaximal pelvic floor contractions—far beyond what manual Kegels can achieve. The treatment strengthens the levator ani, restores neuromuscular control, and improves blood flow to the pelvic organs.\n\nWe prescribe EMSELLA for women facing stress incontinence, postnatal recovery, menopausal laxity, or decreased intimate sensation. Sessions are non-invasive, pain-free, and performed in a private suite while you remain fully clothed.

seo.metaTitle: BTL EMSELLA Chair London | Pelvic Floor Treatment | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Pelvic floor strengthening with BTL EMSELLA in London. Treat stress incontinence, postnatal weakness, and intimacy concerns without downtime.

hero.headline: Stronger Pelvic Floor, Zero Effort
hero.subheadline: Fully clothed sessions that rebuild continence, core stability, and intimate confidence.

overview.title: Pelvic Rehab That Fits Your Schedule
overview.content: EMSELLA’s HIFEM energy penetrates deep into the pelvic floor, causing supramaximal contractions that strengthen the levator ani and surrounding musculature. This improves continence, posture, and sexual satisfaction. Sessions take place in private suites; you simply sit on the chair fully clothed while it does the work.
highlights: Treats mild to moderate stress or urge incontinence
Ideal after childbirth, surgery, or menopause
No need to undress—arrive and leave in everyday clothes
Pairs perfectly with O-Shot® or Ultra Femme 360

areas.name: Levator Ani
areas.description: Primary pelvic floor lift for continence.

howItWorks.title: How HIFEM Restores Strength
howItWorks.subtitle: Beyond traditional Kegels
howItWorks.content: HIFEM energy depolarises motor neurons, causing supramaximal contractions that recruit 100% of the pelvic floor muscle fibres. This re-educates neuromuscular control, increases blood flow, and builds muscle density for long-term support.

candidacy.title: Who Is EMSELLA For?
candidacy.subtitle: If you have pelvic weakness, you qualify
suitable: Women with stress or mixed incontinence
Women preparing for surgery or wanting to avoid it
Patients pairing with Ultra Femme or O-Shot
notSuitable: Recent pelvic surgery (<6 weeks) without surgeon approval
candidacy.note: We perform a medical history review and, if needed, communicate with your GP or consultant before starting.

safety.title: Safety & Governance
safety.content: EMSELLA is FDA-cleared and CE-marked. Our clinic maintains strict calibration logs, infection-control protocols, and chaperone policies. Sessions are overseen by GMC doctors and pelvic physios.

certifications.name: GMC + HCPC Clinicians
certifications.description: Doctors and physiotherapists supervise every plan.

testimonials.name: Laura F.
testimonials.text: Leaking stopped after the third session. I can run and lift my toddler without pads. Staying clothed made the treatment so easy.

testimonials.name: Ruth S.
testimonials.text: Menopause hit my bladder hard. EMSELLA rebuilt muscle tone and I feel confident travelling again.

faq.question: Does EMSELLA hurt?
faq.answer: No—it feels like gentle tingling and deep contractions. You control the intensity.

faq.question: Do I need to undress?
faq.answer: No. Wear comfortable clothing and simply sit on the chair.

faq.question: How soon will I see results?
faq.answer: Many women notice fewer leaks after two sessions; full results peak around week six.

faq.question: Can men use EMSELLA?
faq.answer: Yes, but our current programme focuses on female intimate health. We can refer men to our male programme.

faq.question: Is EMSELLA safe with an IUD?
faq.answer: Most copper and hormonal IUDs are fine, but we confirm with your consultant before treatment.

faq.question: How often do I need maintenance?
faq.answer: We recommend booster sessions every 6–9 months or before high-impact seasons.
